flawed_nl_solution:

He has $5 in $5 bills because 1 times 5 equals <<5*1=5>>5.
He has $3.25 in quarters because 13 times 0.25 equals <<13*0.25=3.25>>3.25
He has $2 in dimes because 20 times 0.1 equals <<20*0.1=2>>2.
He has $0.4 in nickels because 8 times 0.05 equals 0.4.
He has $0.35 in pennies because 35 times 0.01 equals 0.35.
He has $8 because 2 plus 5 plus 3.25 plus 2 plus 0.4 plus 0.35 equals <<2+5+3.25+2+0.4+0.35=8>>8.
